utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, I got the craziest e-mail this morning.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t mean to burst your bubble, dude, but those penile enlargement pills do not work.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Believe me, I know. The e-mail I got was from the office of Stephen Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s coming to the university for a couple weeks to lecture, and he’s looking for an engineer to help maintain the equipment on his wheelchair.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s amazing. You’ll be like his pit crew. A word of caution, I would not do your Stephen Hawking impression in front of him.

utterance.speaker: Howard (in Stephen Hawking voice)
utterance.content: You’re right. I suppose that could be considered offensive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, boy, Sheldon’s going to freak out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, he worships Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I was actually thinking about bringing him along when I go over there so he can meet the great man.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s really nice of you, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hm, it’s no big deal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Boy, a restraining order from Stephen Hawking. It’ll look so nice next to the ones he’s already got from Leonard Nimoy, Carl Sagan and Stan Lee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, do you recall when I said that I was going to revolutionize humanity’s understanding of the Higgs boson particle, and you said, Sheldon, it’s two a.m., get out of my bedroom?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Like it was ten hours ago. What about it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I believe I’ve done it. And I’m only saying believe to sound modest, because, sweet Sam Houston, I did it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s incredible. Oh, here, break out the math.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, okay, let me see this. All right, so this particle here is the boson moving forward in time. Now, I was thinking… Howard, you go ahead and eat. This isn’t going to make any sense to you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, I have a working understanding of physics.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, good for you, and don’t stop working on it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you still going to tell him about you-know-who?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Still going to introduce him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not on your life.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, please, please let me meet Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told you, no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But I said I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, you said, would it help if I said I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you never answered me. So who owes whom an apology now?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you’re a condescending jerk. Why on earth would I want to do something nice for you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um, to go to Jewish heaven?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Jews don’t have heaven.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then to avoid Jewish hell?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Have you met my mother? I live in Jewish hell.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, please. This is Stephen Hawking. Perhaps my only intellectual equal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, you can’t be serious.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Try to put yourself in my place. Imagine you’re the sole human being living on a planet populated with nothing but dogs. And then it turns out there’s another human being.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on. Are you saying the rest of us are dogs?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, I can see you’re going to take this the wrong way. Let me try again. Imagine you’re the sole human being living on a planet populated with nothing but chimps.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Get out of my lab.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, now they’re so much smarter than dogs. Have you seen them on those little bicycles?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Get out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How about dolphins?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Out!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, come on, how was the first day with Hawking?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was great. We talked about movies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I showed him some card tricks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He even let me read a couple pages from his new book.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Something got you down there, bunky?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, please, I’m begging you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Raj, you’re our group historian. Has Sheldon ever begged before?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Three times. He begged the Fox network not to cancel Firefly. He begged the TNT network to cancel Babylon 5. And when he got food poisoning at the Rose Bowl Parade, he begged a deity he doesn’t believe in to end his life quickly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you understand how important Hawking is to me? When I was six years old, I dressed up as him for Halloween.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, sir, no, I took my dad’s desk chair, attached a Speak _ Spell to it and made my sister push me up and down the block to trick or treat. Granted most people thought I was R2-D2, but still, I got a lot of candy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t seem to be understanding the English word no. Maybe a different language will help. Russian, nyet. Chinese, bu. Japanese, iie. Klingon, qo. Binary coded Ascii, 0110111001101111.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s actually 01100111.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not asking for me, I’m asking for Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let me try gansta, hells no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, look, how about this? Just give him my paper on the Higgs boson. If he sees the incredible breakthrough I’ve made, he’ll reach out to me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What if he doesn’t?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He will, he’s really smart.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s an interesting idea. Why don’t you give me a minute to talk it over with my friends?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How do I do that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You walk away.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Walking away.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You do realize you own his ass right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You can make him do anything you want.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, I’m just trying to figure out how much I want to punish him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, don’t be too mean.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, fellas, I’m thinking about making some freshly brewed iced tea if anyone would like some.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I wouldn’t mind a glass.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wasn’t talking to you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bring him to his bony knees.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, come on back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, yes. What did you decide?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll give your paper to Professor Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great, thank you. Oh, that’s terrific.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But in exchange, I’d like you to do a few things for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What kinds of things?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you familiar with the 12 labours of Hercules?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You should be so lucky.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. What would you like me to do first?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I thought I’d start you off by polishing my belt buckles.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. By all means. When I was a boy, I would polish my Mee-Maw’s silver. And she would entertain me with stories about growing up in Oklahoma. Interesting woman. You know, she once killed a prairie dog with a gravy boat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a lot of belt buckles.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Funny thing is, I only have one belt. Anyway, I’ll let you get started. Oh, by the way, the little marks, uh, that look like water spots, I tend to stand too close to the urinal, so what you’re seeing there is splash back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You make sissy on your belt buckles? Mee-Maw’s forks never had that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here is a black light to check them. And for your own peace of mind, you might not want to shine that around the rest of the room.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, these look great. They’re like magnificent little crowns to hang over my magnificent little jewels. How’d you get them so shiny?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I-I buffed them with Turtle Wax. The man down at Pep Boys says from now on, the urine should just bead up and roll right off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Way to go the extra mile. Your Mee-Maw would be proud.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My Mee-Maw must never know of this. Now will you give Professor Hawking my paper?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my dear boy, no. Okay. Next, this is a sexy French maid costume I bought for Bernadette. I thought it might spice things up and get her to dust my room at the same time, but I was wrong and really wrong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you want me to return it for you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, no, no, mon petit cherie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you all staring at? Didn’t you ever see a man try to get a meeting with Stephen Hawking before?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not Saturday night. Why are you doing your laundry?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is not my laundry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, are these Amy’s? Kind of trashy, good for her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Those are Howard’s.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh. Why are you washing Howard’s man panties?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because if I don’t, he won’t give my paper to Stephen Hawking. He’s a famous physicist.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, I know, he’s the wheelchair dude who invented time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s close enough.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t understand, why doesn’t Howard just introduce you to the guy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because he’s punishing me for being a, quote, condescending jerk. You don’t think I’m condescending, do you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry, condescending means…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know what it means. And yes, you love correcting people and putting them down.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Au contraire. When I correct people I am raising them up. You should know, I do it for you more than anyone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, you do it to feel superior. I see that twinkle in your eye when someone says who instead of whom or thinks the moon is a planet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Or Don Quixote is a book about a donkey named Hotay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: See, there it is, there’s that twinkle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I can’t help it. That’s an involuntary twinkle.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you want me to tell you, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want you to tell me that Howard is being mean to me for no reason.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine, Howard is being mean to you for no reason.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I knew it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Every time I spend the night, your mom slaps me on the behind and says, go get ‘im.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not her fault. She’s getting hormone replacement therapy. Makes her crazy horny. Check this out, I got Sheldon to wear the French maid’s costume.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, my God, that’s terrible.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, I gave you first crack at it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why are you doing that? You’re being mean to him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s mean to me all the time. You’ve heard him tease me about not having a doctorate.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If you don’t want to get teased about that, get a doctorate. I have one, they’re great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on, the man torments me. I’m just letting him have a little taste of his own medicine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s not the same thing. Sheldon doesn’t know when he’s being mean because the part of his brain that should know is getting a wedgie from the rest of his brain.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll just make him do a couple more things, then I’ll stop.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, you have to stop now.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Bernadette, I want to remind you, you promised to take me dress shopping tomorrow!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, damn. I’m sorry, I can’t make it, but Sheldon’s going to go with you! And that’s the last thing you do to him.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Sheldon! I need your help!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is it now, Mrs. Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: It’s this dress. When I put my front in, my back pops out. When I put my back in, my front pops out. It’s like trying to keep two dogs in a bathtub!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do you want me to do?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: We’re gonna have to work as a team. Get in here, grab a handful, and start stuffing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: I’m not sure how to do this.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: It’s easy, just pretend you’re putting away a sleeping bag.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Sleeping bags don’t usually sweat this much, but okay.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Now zip me up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (off)
utterance.content: Oh, if we squeeze you any tighter, you may turn into a diamond.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: You’re right, who am I kidding? You should have seen me when I was young, Sheldon. The fellas used to line up and bring me boxes of candy. Why did I eat it all? Would you hold me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, you know, I’m not really the holding kind of… Oh!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, guys, I just remembered. I got you some Hawking souvenirs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are these?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Gears and springs from his wheelchair. Pretty cool, huh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow, that’s amazing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I made an adjustment on the motor drive and when I was putting it back together I could not for the life of me figure out where they went.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I did it. Had to go to three clothing stores, but we finally found a dress that could envelop your mother.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I should have sent you to the custom car cover place in Altadena. They have her pattern on file.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Humorous. Now will you please present my paper to Professor Hawking?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, for heaven’s sake. I did your laundry, I pee-pee-proofed your belt buckles, I, I even sprained my wrist helping your mother lift her bosom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, Sheldon, there’s only one thing left I want you to do. Don’t worry, it’s an easy one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Give me a compliment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. You have very tiny hands.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, about my job. I want you to tell me I’m good at what I do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re obviously good at what you do.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, then why are you always ripping on me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I understand the confusion. I have never said that you are not good at what you do. It’s just that what you do is not worth doing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s nicer than anything he’s ever said to me. I’d take it and run.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now will you give my paper to Hawking?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry, I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, why not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I gave it to him three days ago. He was really impressed. He wants to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, then. Thank you, Howard. Please let Professor Hawking know that I’m available at his earliest convenience.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I thought he might be a little more excited.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Give it a second.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Professor Hawking, it’s an honour and a privilege to meet you, sir.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want to thank you for taking time to see me.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: My pleasure. I enjoyed reading your paper very much. You clearly have a brilliant mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: Your thesis that the Higgs boson is a black hole accelerating backwards through time is fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. It just, it came to me one morning in the shower.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: That’s nice. Too bad it’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What do you mean wrong?

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: You made an arithmetic mistake on page two. It was quite the boner.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, th-th-th-that can’t be right. I-I don’t make arithmetic mistakes.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: Are you saying I do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, of course not. It’s just, I was thinking… Oh, gosh, golly, I made a boo-boo, and I gave it to Stephen Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: Great, another fainter.
